name: search_recipes
description: Search through thousands of recipes using advanced filtering and ranking. NOTE: Since this method combines searching by query, by ingredients, and by nutrients into one endpoint, each request counts as 3 requests.

cuisine.description: The cuisine(s) of the recipes. One or more (comma separated) of the following: african, chinese, japanese, korean, vietnamese, thai, indian, british, irish, french, italian, mexican, spanish, middle eastern, jewish, american, cajun, southern, greek, german, nordic, eastern european, caribbean, or latin american.
cuisine.title: Cuisine

excludeCuisine.description: The cuisine(s) the recipes must not match. One or more, comma separated (will be interpreted as 'AND'). See a full list of supported cuisines.
excludeCuisine.title: Excludecuisine

diet.description: The diet to which the recipes must be compliant. Possible values are: pescetarian, lacto vegetarian, ovo vegetarian, vegan, paleo, primal, and vegetarian.
diet.title: Diet

intolerances.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All found recipes must not have ingredients that could cause problems for people with one of the given tolerances. Possible values are: dairy, egg, gluten, peanut, sesame, seafood, shellfish, soy, sulfite, tree nut, and wheat.
intolerances.title: Intolerances

includeIngredients.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients that should/must be contained in the recipe.
includeIngredients.title: Includeingredients

excludeIngredients.description: An comma-separated list of ingredients that must not be contained in the recipes.
excludeIngredients.title: Excludeingredients

type.description: The type of the recipes. One of the following: main course, side dish, dessert, appetizer, salad, bread, breakfast, soup, beverage, sauce, or drink.
type.title: Type

instructionsRequired.description: Whether the recipes must have instructions.
instructionsRequired.title: Instructionsrequired

fillIngredients.description: Add information about the used and missing ingredients in each recipe.
fillIngredients.title: Fillingredients

addRecipeInformation.description: If set to true, you get more information about the recipes returned. This saves the calls to get recipe information.
addRecipeInformation.title: Addrecipeinformation

addRecipeInstructions.description: If set to true, you get analyzed instructions for each recipe returned.
addRecipeInstructions.title: Addrecipeinstructions

addRecipeNutrition.description: If set to true, you get nutritional information about each recipes returned.
addRecipeNutrition.title: Addrecipenutrition

author.description: The username of the recipe author.
author.title: Author

tags.description: User defined tags that have to match. The author param has to be set.
tags.title: Tags

recipeBoxId.description: The id of the recipe box to which the search should be limited to. Default: 0
recipeBoxId.title: Recipeboxid

titleMatch.description: A string that the recipes must contain in their titles.
titleMatch.title: Titlematch

maxReadyTime.description: The maximum time in minutes it should take to prepare and cook the recipe. Default: 45
maxReadyTime.title: Maxreadytime

ignorePantry.description: Whether to ignore typical pantry items, such as water, salt, flour, etc.
ignorePantry.title: Ignorepantry

sort.description: The strategy to sort recipes by. See the full list of supported sorting options.
sort.title: Sort

sortDirection.description: The direction in which to sort. Must be either 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending).
sortDirection.title: Sortdirection

minCarbs.description: The minimum number of grams of carbohydrates the recipe must have. Default: 0
minCarbs.title: Mincarbs

maxCarbs.description: The maximum number of grams of carbohydrates the recipe can have. Default: 0
maxCarbs.title: Maxcarbs

minProtein.description: The minimum number of grams of protein the recipe must have. Default: 0
minProtein.title: Minprotein

maxProtein.description: The maximum number of grams of protein the recipe can have. Default: 0
maxProtein.title: Maxprotein

minCalories.description: The minimum number of calories the recipe must have. Default: 0
minCalories.title: Mincalories

maxCalories.description: The maximum number of calories the recipe can have. Default: 0
maxCalories.title: Maxcalories

minFat.description: The minimum number of grams of fat the recipe must have. Default: 0
minFat.title: Minfat

maxFat.description: The maximum number of grams of fat the recipe can have. Default: 0
maxFat.title: Maxfat

maxAlcohol.description: The maximum number of grams of alcohol the recipe can have. Default: 0
maxAlcohol.title: Maxalcohol

ranking.description: Whether to minimize missing ingredients (0), maximize used ingredients (1) first, or rank recipes by relevance (2). Default: 0

name: search_recipes_complex

name: search_recipes_by_nutrients
description: Find a set of recipes that adhere to the given nutrient limits. All the found recipes will have macro nutrients within the calories, protein, fat, and carbohydrate limits.

name: search_recipes_by_ingredients
description: Find recipes that use as many of the given ingredients as possible and have as little as possible missing ingredients. This is a whats in your fridge API endpoint.

ingredients.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients that the recipes should contain.
ingredients.title: Ingredients

number.description: The maximal number of recipes to return (default = 5). Default: 5
number.title: Number

ignorePantry.description: Whether to ignore pantry ingredients such as water, salt, flour etc..
ignorePantry.title: Ignorepantry

ranking.description: Whether to maximize used ingredients (1) or minimize missing ingredients (2) first. Default: 1
ranking.title: Ranking

name: get_recipe_information
description: Get information about a recipe.

includeNutrition.description: Include nutrition data to the recipe information. Nutrition data is per serving. If you want the nutrition data for the entire recipe, just multiply by the number of servings.
includeNutrition.title: Includenutrition

name: get_recipe_information_bulk
description: Get information about multiple recipes at once. That is equivalent of calling the Get Recipe Information endpoint multiple times but is faster. Note that each returned recipe counts as one request.

ids.description: A comma-separated list of recipe ids.
ids.title: Ids

includeNutrition.description: Include nutrition data to the recipe information.
includeNutrition.title: Includenutrition

name: get_similar_recipes
description: Find recipes which are similar to the given one.

name: get_random_recipes
description: Find random (popular) recipes.

tags.description: Tags that the random recipe(s) must adhere to.
tags.title: Tags

number.description: The number of random recipes to be returned. Must be in interval [1,100]. NOTE: Each random recipe returned counts as one request. Default: 1
number.title: Number

name: autocomplete_recipe_search
description: Autocomplete a partial input to possible recipe names.

number.description: The number of results between [1,25]. Default: 10
number.title: Number

name: taste_by_id
description: Get a recipe's taste. The tastes supported are sweet, salty, sour, bitter, savory, and fatty. These tastes are between 0 and 100 while the spiciness value is in scoville on an open scale of 0 and above. Every ingredient has each of these values and it is weighted by how much they contribute to the recipe. Spiciness is taking the weight of the spicy ingredient and multiplying it with its scoville amount. Of course, taste is also very personal and it depends on how it is prepared so all of the values should only give you an indication of how the dish tastes.

name: equipment_by_id
description: Get a recipe's equipment list.

name: price_breakdown_by_id
description: Get a recipe's price breakdown data.

name: ingredients_by_id
description: Get a recipe's ingredient list.

name: nutrition_by_id
description: Get a recipe's nutrition widget data.

name: get_analyzed_recipe_instructions
description: Get an analyzed breakdown of a recipe's instructions. Each step is enriched with the ingredients and the equipment that is used.

stepBreakdown.description: Whether to break down the recipe steps even more.
stepBreakdown.title: Stepbreakdown

name: extract_recipe_from_website
description: Extract recipe data from a recipe blog or Web page.

url.description: The URL of the recipe page.
url.title: Url

forceExtraction.description: If true, the extraction will be triggered no matter whether we know the recipe already. Use that only if information is missing as this operation is slower.
forceExtraction.title: Forceextraction

name: analyze_recipe
description: This endpoint allows you to send raw recipe information, such as title, servings, and ingredients, to then see what we compute (badges, diets, nutrition, and more). This is useful if you have your own recipe data and want to enrich it with our semantic analysis.

name: summarize_recipe
description: Summarize the recipe in a short text.

name: analyze_recipe_instructions
description: Extract ingredients and equipment from the recipe instruction steps.

name: classify_cuisine
description: Classify the recipe's cuisine.

name: analyze_arecipe_search_query
description: Parse a recipe search query to find out its intention.

name: guess_nutrition_by_dish_name
description: Guess the macro nutrients of a dish given its title.

name: ingredient_search
description: Search for simple whole foods (e.g. fruits, vegetables, nuts, grains, meat, fish, dairy etc.).

query.description: The partial or full ingredient name.
query.title: Query

addChildren.description: Whether to add children of found foods.
addChildren.title: Addchildren

minProteinPercent.description: The minimum percentage of protein the food must have (between 0 and 100). Default: 5
minProteinPercent.title: Minproteinpercent

maxProteinPercent.description: The maximum percentage of protein the food can have (between 0 and 100). Default: 50
maxProteinPercent.title: Maxproteinpercent

minFatPercent.description: The minimum percentage of fat the food must have (between 0 and 100). Default: 1
minFatPercent.title: Minfatpercent

maxFatPercent.description: The maximum percentage of fat the food can have (between 0 and 100). Default: 10
maxFatPercent.title: Maxfatpercent

minCarbsPercent.description: The minimum percentage of carbs the food must have (between 0 and 100). Default: 5
minCarbsPercent.title: Mincarbspercent

maxCarbsPercent.description: The maximum percentage of carbs the food can have (between 0 and 100). Default: 30
maxCarbsPercent.title: Maxcarbspercent

metaInformation.description: Whether to return more meta information about the ingredients.
metaInformation.title: Metainformation

intolerances.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All recipes returned must not contain ingredients that are not suitable for people with the intolerances entered. See a full list of supported intolerances.
intolerances.title: Intolerances

sort.description: The strategy to sort recipes by. See a full list of supported sorting options.
sort.title: Sort

sortDirection.description: The direction in which to sort. Must be either 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending).
sortDirection.title: Sortdirection

offset.description: The number of results to skip (between 0 and 990).
offset.title: Offset

number.description: The number of expected results (between 1 and 100). Default: 10
number.title: Number

name: get_ingredient_information
description: Use an ingredient id to get all available information about an ingredient, such as its image and supermarket aisle.

amount.description: The amount of that food. Default: 150
amount.title: Amount

unit.description: The unit for the given amount.
unit.title: Unit

name: compute_ingredient_amount
description: Compute the amount you need of a certain ingredient for a certain nutritional goal. For example, how much soy milk do you have to drink to get 10 grams of protein?

target.description: The target number of the given nutrient. Default: 10
target.title: Target

name: convert_amounts
description: Convert amounts like "2 cups of flour to grams".

ingredientName.description: The ingredient which you want to convert, e.g. the flour in "2.5 cups of flour to grams"
ingredientName.title: Ingredientname

targetUnit.description: The unit to which you want to convert, e.g. the grams in "2.5 cups of flour to grams". You can also use "piece", e.g. "3.4 oz tomatoes to piece"
targetUnit.title: Targetunit

sourceUnit.description: The unit from which you want to convert, e.g. the cups in "2.5 cups of flour to grams". You can also use "serving" or "piece".
sourceUnit.title: Sourceunit

sourceAmount.description: The amount from which you want to convert, e.g. the 2.5 in "2.5 cups of flour to grams" Default: 2.5
sourceAmount.title: Sourceamount

name: parse_ingredients
description: Extract an ingredient from plain text.

name: compute_glycemic_load
description: Retrieve the glycemic index for a list of ingredients and compute the individual and total glycemic load.

name: autocomplete_ingredient_search
description: Autocomplete a search for an ingredient.

query.description: The query - a partial or full ingredient name.
query.title: Query

number.description: The number of results to return, between [1,100] Default: 10
number.title: Number

metaInformation.description: Whether to return more meta information about the ingredients.
metaInformation.title: Metainformation

intolerances.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All found ingredients must not cause problems for people with one of the given tolerances. Possible values are: dairy, egg, gluten, peanut, sesame, seafood, shellfish, soy, sulfite, tree nut, and wheat.
intolerances.title: Intolerances

name: get_ingredient_substitutes
description: Get ingredient substitutes by ingredient name.

ingredientName.description: The name of the ingredient you want to replace.
ingredientName.title: Ingredientname

name: get_ingredient_substitutes_by_id
description: Search for substitutes for a given ingredient.

name: search_grocery_products
description: Search packaged food products like frozen pizza and snickers bars.

maxCalories.description: The maximum number of calories the product can have. Default: 5000
maxCalories.title: Maxcalories

minProtein.description: The minimum number of grams of protein the product can have. Default: 0
minProtein.title: Minprotein

maxProtein.description: The maximum number of grams of protein the product can have. Default: 100
maxProtein.title: Maxprotein

minFat.description: The minimum number of grams of fat the product can have. Default: 0
minFat.title: Minfat

maxFat.description: The maximum number of grams of fat the product can have. Default: 100
maxFat.title: Maxfat

minCarbs.description: The minimum number of grams of carbs the product can have. Default: 0
minCarbs.title: Mincarbs

maxCarbs.description: The maximum number of grams of carbs the product can have. Default: 100
maxCarbs.title: Maxcarbs

minCalories.description: The minimum number of calories the product can have. Default: 0
minCalories.title: Mincalories

offset.description: The number of results to skip, defaults to 0. Default: 0
offset.title: Offset

number.description: The number of results to retrieve, defaults to 10. Default: 10
number.title: Number

name: search_grocery_products_by_upc
description: Get information about a food product given its UPC.

name: get_product_information
description: Get information about a packaged food product.

name: get_comparable_products
description: Find comparable products to the given one.

name: autocomplete_product_search
description: Generate suggestions for grocery products based on a (partial) query. The matches will be found by looking in the title only.

number.description: The number of results to return. Must be between 1 and 25. Default: 10
number.title: Number

name: classify_agrocery_product
description: Given a grocery product title, this endpoint allows you to detect what basic ingredient it is.

name: classify_grocery_product_bulk
description: Provide a set of product jsons, get back classified products.

name: map_ingredients_to_grocery_products
description: Map a set of ingredients to products you can buy in the grocery store.

name: search_menu_items
description: Search menu items (such as McDonalds Big Mac)

number.description: The number of results to return. Default: 10
number.title: Number

minCalories.description: The minimum number of calories the menu item can have Default: 0
minCalories.title: Mincalories

maxCalories.description: The maximum number of calories the menu item can have Default: 5000
maxCalories.title: Maxcalories

minProtein.description: The minimum number of grams of protein the menu item can have Default: 0
minProtein.title: Minprotein

maxProtein.description: The maximum number of grams of protein the menu item can have Default: 100
maxProtein.title: Maxprotein

minFat.description: The minimum number of grams of fat the menu item can have. Default: 0
minFat.title: Minfat

maxFat.description: The maximum number of grams of fat the menu item can have. Default: 100
maxFat.title: Maxfat

minCarbs.description: The minimum number of grams of carbs the menu item can have. Default: 0
minCarbs.title: Mincarbs

maxCarbs.description: The maximum number of grams of carbs the menu item can have. Default: 100
maxCarbs.title: Maxcarbs

name: get_menu_item_information
description: Get information about a certain menu item.

name: autocomplete_menu_item_search
description: Generate suggestions for menu items based on a (partial) query. The matches will be found by looking in the title only.

number.description: The number of results to return. Must be between 1 and 25. Default: 10
number.title: Number

name: get_meal_plan_week
description: Retrieve a meal planned week for the given user. The username must be a spoonacular user and the hash must the the user's hash that can be found in his/her account.

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

name: get_meal_plan_day
description: Retrieve a meal planned day for the given user. The username must be a spoonacular user and the hash must the the user's hash that can be found in his/her account.

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

name: generate_meal_plan
description: Generate a meal plan with three meals per day (breakfast, lunch, and dinner).

timeFrame.description: Either for one 'day' or an entire 'week'.
timeFrame.title: Timeframe

targetCalories.description: What is the caloric target for one day? The meal plan generator will try to get as close as possible to that goal. Default: 2000
targetCalories.title: Targetcalories

diet.description: Enter a diet that the meal plan has to adhere to, e.g. "vegetarian", "vegan", "paleo" etc.
diet.title: Diet

exclude.description: A comma-separated list of allergens or ingredients that must be excluded.
exclude.title: Exclude

name: add_to_meal_plan
description: Add an item to the user's meal plan. The Add to Meal Plan endpoint is complex, be sure to review the [guide here](https://spoonacular.com/food-api/docs#Add-to-Meal-Plan)

name: clear_meal_plan_day
description: Delete all planned items from the user's meal plan for a specific day.

name: delete_from_meal_plan
description: Delete an item from the user's meal plan.

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

name: get_meal_plan_templates
description: Get meal plan templates from user or public ones. This documentation is for getting user templates. You can also get public templates. Read more about this [here](https://spoonacular.com/food-api/docs#Get-Meal-Plan-Templates).

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

name: get_meal_plan_template
description: Get information about a meal plan template.

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

name: add_meal_plan_template
description: Add a meal plan template for a user.

name: delete_meal_plan_template
description: Delete a meal plan template for a user.

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

name: get_shopping_list
description: Get the current shopping list for the given user.

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

name: add_to_shopping_list
description: Add an item to the current shopping list of a user.

name: delete_from_shopping_list
description: Delete an item from the current shopping list of the user.

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

name: generate_shopping_list
description: Generate the shopping list for a user from the meal planner in a given time frame.

name: compute_shopping_list
description: Compute a shopping list from a set of simple foods. This endpoint does not require usernames.

name: search_custom_foods
description: Search custom foods in a user's account.

hash.description: The private hash for the username.
hash.title: Hash

offset.description: The number of results to skip (between 0 and 990). Default: 0
offset.title: Offset

number.description: The number of expected results (between 1 and 100). Default: 10
number.title: Number

name: connect_user
description: In order to call user-specific endpoints, you need to connect your app's users to spoonacular users. Just call this endpoint with your user's information and you will get back a username and hash that you must save on your side. In future requests that you make on this user's behalf you simply pass their username and hash alongside your API key.

name: dish_pairing_for_wine
description: Find a dish that goes well with a given wine.

wine.description: The type of wine that should be paired, e.g. "merlot", "riesling", or "malbec".
wine.title: Wine

name: wine_pairing
description: Find a wine that goes well with a food. Food can be a dish name ("lasagna"), an ingredient name ("salmon"), or a cuisine ("italian").

food.description: The food to get a pairing for. This can be a dish ("steak"), an ingredient ("salmon"), or a cuisine ("italian").
food.title: Food

maxPrice.description: The maximum price for the specific wine recommendation. Default: 50
maxPrice.title: Maxprice

name: wine_description
description: Get a simple description of a certain wine, e.g. "malbec", "riesling", or "merlot".

wine.description: The name of the wine, e.g. "malbec", "riesling", or "merlot".
wine.title: Wine

name: wine_recommendation
description: Get a specific wine recommendation (concrete product) for a given wine type, e.g. "merlot".

wine.description: The name of the wine to get a specific product recommendation for.
wine.title: Wine

maxPrice.description: The maximum price of the recommended wine. Default: 50
maxPrice.title: Maxprice

minRating.description: The minimum rating of the recommended wine between 0 and 1. For example, 0.8 equals 4 out of 5 stars. Default: 0.7
minRating.title: Minrating

number.description: The number of wine recommendations expected. Default: 3
number.title: Number

name: search_all_food
description: Search all food content with one call. That includes recipes, grocery products, menu items, simple foods (ingredients), and food videos.

name: image_classification
description: Classify a food image.

name: image_analysis
description: Classify and analyze a food image.

name: search_food_videos
description: Find recipe and other food related videos.

type.description: The type of the recipe, e.g. one of the following: main course, side dish, dessert, appetizer, salad, bread, breakfast, soup, beverage, sauce, or drink.
type.title: Type

minLength.description: Minimum video length in seconds. Default: 0
minLength.title: Minlength

maxLength.description: Maximum video length in seconds. Default: 999
maxLength.title: Maxlength

cuisine.description: The cuisine of the videos, e.g. one of the following: african, chinese, japanese, korean, vietnamese, thai, indian, british, irish, french, italian, mexican, spanish, middle eastern, jewish, american, cajun, southern, greek, german, nordic, eastern european, caribbean, latin american
cuisine.title: Cuisine

includeingredients.description: Ingredients the recipe videos must contain.
includeingredients.title: Includeingredients

excludeingredients.description: Ingredients the recipe videos must not contain.
excludeingredients.title: Excludeingredients

offset.description: The offset in the result set [0,900]. Default: 0
offset.title: Offset

name: quick_answer
description: Answer a nutrition related natural language question.

name: detect_food_in_text
description: Detect ingredients and dishes in texts.

name: search_site_content
description: Search spoonacular's site content. You'll be able to find everything that you could also find using the search suggests on spoonacular.com. This is a suggest API so you can send partial strings as queries.

query.description: The query to search for. You can also use partial queries such as "spagh" to already find spaghetti recipes, articles, grocery products, and other content.
query.title: Query

name: get_arandom_food_joke
description: Get a random joke that includes or is about food.

name: get_random_food_trivia
description: Returns random food trivia.

name: talk_to_chatbot
description: This endpoint can be used to have a conversation about food with the spoonacular chat bot. Use the chat suggests endpoint to show your user what he or she can say.

text.description: The request/question/answer from the user to the chat bot.
text.title: Text

contextId.description: An arbitrary globally unique id for your conversation. The conversation can contain states so you should pass your context id if you want the bot to be able to remember the conversation.
contextId.title: Contextid

name: conversation_suggests
description: This endpoint returns suggestions for things the user can say or ask the chat bot.

query.description: A (partial) query from the user. The endpoint will return if it matches topics it can talk about.
query.title: Query

number.description: The number of suggestions to return must be in interval [1,25]. Default: 10
number.title: Number

name: recipe_nutrition_label_widget
description: Get a recipe's nutrition label as an HTML widget.

defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.
defaultCss.title: Defaultcss

name: recipe_nutrition_label_image
description: Get a recipe's nutrition label as an image.

name: recipe_nutrition_widget
description: Visualize a recipe's nutritional information as HTML including CSS. Full example code of how to work with widgets can be found in our [spoonacular-widget GitHub](https://github.com/ddsky/spoonacular-widgets).

name: recipe_nutrition_by_id_widget
description: Visualize a recipe's nutritional information as HTML including CSS.

name: recipe_nutrition_by_id_image
description: Visualize a recipe's nutritional information as an image.

name: equipment_by_id_widget
description: Visualize a recipe's equipment list.

name: equipment_widget
description: Visualize the equipment used to make a recipe.

name: equipment_by_id_image
description: Visualize a recipe's equipment list as an image.

name: ingredients_widget
description: Visualize ingredients of a recipe.

name: ingredients_by_id_widget
description: Visualize a recipe's ingredient list.

defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.
defaultCss.title: Defaultcss

measure.description: Whether the the measures should be 'us' or 'metric'.
measure.title: Measure

name: ingredients_by_id_image
description: Visualize a recipe's ingredient list.

measure.description: Whether the the measures should be 'us' or 'metric'.
measure.title: Measure

name: price_breakdown_widget
description: Visualize the price breakdown of a recipe.

name: price_breakdown_by_id_image
description: Visualize a recipe's price breakdown.

mode.description: The mode in which the widget should be delivered. 1 = separate views (compact), 2 = all in one view (full). Default: 1
mode.title: Mode

name: product_nutrition_label_widget
description: Get a product's nutrition label as an HTML widget.

defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.
defaultCss.title: Defaultcss

showIngredients.description: Whether to show a list of ingredients.
showIngredients.title: Showingredients

name: product_nutrition_label_image
description: Get a product's nutrition label as an image.

showIngredients.description: Whether to show a list of ingredients.
showIngredients.title: Showingredients

name: product_nutrition_by_id_widget
description: Visualize a product's nutritional information as HTML including CSS.

defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.
defaultCss.title: Defaultcss

name: product_nutrition_by_id_image
description: Visualize a product's nutritional information as an image.

name: menu_item_nutrition_label_widget
